column1: Bayonne ( bay-OWN) is a city in Hudson County
column2: New Jersey
column3: United States. Located in the Gateway Region
column4: Bayonne is situated on a peninsula located between Newark Bay to the west
column5: the Kill Van Kull to the south
column6: and New York Bay to the east. As of the 2010 United States Census

column2: the region presently known as Bayonne was claimed by the Netherlands after Henry Hudson explored the Hudson River which is named after him. According to Royden Page Whitcomb's 1904 book
column3: First History of Bayonne
column4: New Jersey
column5: the name Bayonne is speculated to have originated with Bayonne
column6: France
column7: from which Huguenots settled for a year before the founding of New Amsterdam. However
column8: there is no empirical evidence for this notion
column9: which is considered apocryphal. Whitcomb gives more credence to the idea that Erastus Randall
column11: who bought the land owned by Jasper and William Cadmus for real estate speculation
column12: named it Bayonne for purposes of real estate speculation
column13: because it was located on the shores of two bays
column14: Newark and New York.Bayonne became one of the largest centers in the nation for refining crude oil and Standard Oil of New Jersey's facility – which had grown from its original establishment in 1877 – and its 6
column15: 000 employees made it the city's largest place of employment. Significant civil unrest arose during the Bayonne refinery strikes of 1915–1916
column16: in which mostly Polish American workers staged labor actions against Standard Oil of New Jersey and Tidewater Petroleum
column17: seeking improved pay and working conditions. Four striking workers were killed when strikebreakers protected by police fired into a crowd.The Cape Liberty Cruise Port is a cruise ship terminal that is on a 430-acre (170 ha) site that had been originally developed for industrial uses in the 1930s and then taken over by the U.S. government during World War II as the Military Ocean Terminal at Bayonne. Voyager of the Seas
column18: departing from the cruise terminal in 2004
column19: became the first passenger ship to depart from a port in New Jersey in almost 40 years.

column1: Bayonne has a humid subtropical climate (Cfa) bordering a hot-summer humid continental climate (Dfa). The average monthly temperature varies from 32.3 °F in January to 77.0 °F in July. The hardiness zone is 7b and the average absolute minimum temperature is 5.2 °F.
The city has a very ethnically diverse population

column3: Irish Americans
column4: Polish Americans
column5: Indian Americans
column6: Egyptian Americans

column1: Portions of the city are part of an Urban Enterprise Zone (UEZ)
column2: one of 32 zones covering 37 municipalities statewide. Bayonne was selected in 2002 as one of a group of three zones added to participate in the program. In addition to other benefits to encourage employment and investment within the Zone
column3: shoppers can take advantage of a reduced 3.3125% sales tax rate (half of the ​6 5⁄8% rate charged statewide) at eligible merchants. Established in September 2002
column4: the city's Urban Enterprise Zone status expires in December 2023. More than 200 businesses have registered to participate in the city's UEZ since it was first established.The Bayonne Town Center
column5: located within the Broadway shopping district
column6: includes retailers
column8: consumer and small business banking centers. The Bayonne Medical Center is a for-profit hospital that anchors the northern end of the Town Center. It is the city's largest employer
column10: 200 employees. A 2013 study showed that the hospital charged the highest rates in the United States.Bayonne Crossing on Route 440 in Bayonne
column13: and Wal-Mart.On the site of the former Military Ocean Terminal
column14: the Peninsula at Bayonne Harbor includes new housing and businesses. One of them
column15: Cape Liberty Cruise Port is located at the end of the long peninsula with Royal Caribbean. Also found is a memorial park for the Tear of Grief
column18: 2001 terrorist attacks and the 1993 World Trade Center bombing.The firearms manufacturing company Henry Repeating Arms moved from Brooklyn to Bayonne in 2009.

column1: The City of Bayonne has been governed within the Faulkner Act
column2: formally known as the Optional Municipal Charter Law
column3: under the Mayor-Council system of municipal government (Plan C)
column4: implemented based on the recommendations of a Charter Study Commission as of July 1
column6: before which it was governed by a Board of Commissioners under the Walsh Act. The city is one of 71 municipalities (of the 565) statewide that use this form of government. The governing body is comprised of the Mayor and the five-member City Council
column7: of which two seats are chosen at-large and three from wards
column8: all of whom serve four-year terms of office on a concurrent basis and are chosen in balloting held as part of the May municipal election.As of 2020
column9: the Mayor of Bayonne is James M. "Jimmy" Davis
column10: whose term of office ends June 30
column11: 2022; Davis was first elected as mayor in a runoff election on June 10
column13: against incumbent Mayor Mark Smith. Members of the Bayonne City Council are Council President Sharon Ashe-Nadrowski (At-Large)
column14: Neil Carroll III (1st Ward; appointed to serve an unexpired term)
column16: Gary La Pelusa Sr. (3rd Ward) and Juan M. Perez (At-Large)
column17: all of whom are serving concurrent terms of office that end on June 30
column19: the City Council appointed Neil Carroll III to fill the 1st Ward seat vacated by Tommy Cotter
column20: who resigned to take a position as the city's DPW director; at age 27
column21: Carroll became the youngest councilmember in city history. In the November 2019 general election
column22: Carroll was elected to serve the balance of the term of office.

column1: The Bayonne Municipal Utilities Authority (BMUA) is the second agency to use wind power in New Jersey and has built the first wind turbine in the metropolitan area. Construction of a single turbine tower was completed in January 2012. It is the first wind turbine created by Leitwind to be installed in the United States.In December 2012
column2: the autonomous agency entered into a water management agreement with the Bayonne Water Joint Venture (BWJV)
column3: a partnership between United Water and investment firm Kohlberg
column4: Kravis
column5: Roberts. The 40-year concession agreement is a public-private partnership between the city and the BWJV in which the private partners pay off the BMUA's $130 million debt and take over the operations
column6: maintenance
column7: and capital improvement of Bayonne's water and wastewater utilities in exchange for a regulated share of the revenue. United Water is managing the operations for the partnership
column8: while KKR is providing 90% of the funding. A rate schedule was included in the agreement
column9: and it contained an immediate 8.5% utility rate increase (the first rate increase since 2006)
column10: followed by two years without increases
column11: followed by annual increases estimated to range between 2.5% - 4.5%. This partnership was sought for several reasons
column14: and its lagging rate revenue from years without rate increases and reduced demand. Part of this reduced demand stemmed from the closure of the Military Ocean Terminal at Bayonne
column15: and the fact that the subsequent plans to redevelop the site with housing fell short. The BMUA's $130 million debt that was paid off by the BWJV represented over half of Bayonne's overall debt ($240 million) at the time
column17: Moody's Investors Service upgraded the credit rating of Bayonne from 'negative' to 'stable'

column1: The city of Bayonne is protected on a full-time
column2: around-the-clock basis by the 161 professional firefighters of the city of Bayonne Fire Department (BFD)
column3: which was founded on September 3
column5: and operates out of five fire stations
column6: located throughout the city. The BFD operates a fire apparatus fleet of four engines
column9: one rescue truck (which is also part of the Metro USAR Collapse Rescue Strike Team)
column18: support and reserve units. Each piece of apparatus is staffed by three fire fighters and a captain. Each platoon works on a 24 hours on
column19: 72 hours off schedule and is commanded by a Battalion Chief. The BFD responds to approximately 17
column20: 000 emergency calls annually. The current Chief of Department is Keith Weaver.The department is part of the Metro USAR Strike Team
column21: which consists of nine North Jersey fire departments and other emergency services divisions working to address major emergency rescue situations.

column1: Private schools in Bayonne include All Saints Catholic Academy for grades PreK-8 and the co-ed Marist High School for grades 9-12
column2: All Saints operates under the supervision of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Newark
column3: while Marist High School operates under the Marist Brothers. All Saints was one of eight private schools recognized in 2017 as an Exemplary High Performing School by the National Blue Ribbon Schools Program of the United States Department of Education. Marist High School has been ranked in the top 50 private schools in New Jersey. [1] It is one of a few high schools across the nation that provides an associate's degree program.

column1: The Yeshiva Gedolah of Bayonne is a yeshiva high school / Bais Medrash / Kolel with 130 students.Holy Family Academy for girls in ninth through twelfth grades was closed at the end of the 2012-13 school year in the wake of financial difficulties and declining enrollment
column2: having lost the support of the Sisters of St. Joseph of Chestnut Hill

column7: connecting south to Staten Island over the Kill Van Kull. Originally constructed in 1931
column8: the nridge underwent a Navigation Clearance Project that was completed in 2017 at a cost of $1.7 billion
column9: that raised the bridge deck from 151 feet (46 m) above the water to 215 feet (66 m)

column2: via the Holland Tunnel

column1: The Hudson-Bergen Light Rail has four stops in Bayonne
column2: all originally from the former Central Railroad of New Jersey (CNJ). They are located at 45th Street
column3: 34th Street
column4: 22nd Street
column5: all just east of Avenue E
column6: and 8th Street (the southern terminal of the 8th Street-Hoboken Line) at Avenue C
column7: which opened in January 2011.Bus transportation is provided on three main north-south streets of the city: Broadway
column10: both by the state-operated NJ Transit and several private bus lines. The Broadway line runs solely inside Bayonne city limits
column11: while bus lines on Avenue C and Kennedy Boulevard run to various end points in Jersey City. The NJ Transit 120 runs between Avenue C in Bayonne and Battery Park in Downtown Manhattan during rush hours in peak direction while the 81 provides service to Jersey City.MTA Regional Bus Operations provides bus service between Bayonne and Staten Island on the S89 route
column12: which connects the 34th Street light rail station and the Eltingville neighborhood on Staten Island with no other stops in Bayonne. It is the first interstate bus service operated by the New York City Transit Authority.For 114 years
column13: the CNJ ran frequent service through the city. Trains ran north to the Central Railroad of New Jersey Terminal in Jersey City. Trains ran west to Elizabethport
column14: Elizabeth and Cranford for points west and south. The implementation of the Aldene Connection in 1967 bypassed CNJ trains around Bayonne so that nearly all trains would either terminate at Newark Pennsylvania Station or at Hoboken Terminal. By 1973
column15: a lightly used shuttle between Bayonne and Cranford that operated 20 times per day was the final remnant of service on the line. Until August 6
column17: a shuttle service between Bayonne and Cranford retained the last leg of service with the CNJ trains.

column1: The Bayonne Bridge is the fifth-longest steel arch bridge in the world. For the more than 45 years from its dedication in 1931 until the completion of the New River Gorge Bridge
column2: the Bayonne Bridge was the world's longest such bridge.

column1: To the Struggle Against World Terrorism is a 100-foot (30 m) high sculpture by Zurab Tsereteli located at the end of the former Military Ocean Terminal that was given to the United States as an official gift of the Russian government as a memorial to the victims of the September 11
column2: 2001 terrorist attacks and the 1993 World Trade Center bombing. Russian President Vladimir Putin attended a groundbreaking ceremony in September 2005 and the monument was dedicated on September 11
column4: in a ceremony attended by former President Bill Clinton as the keynote speaker.
